enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Pre-registration is reserved for Statistics Majors and Minors only.
title: WCAS STAT 351-0-20 Design and Analysis of Experiments

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
This is an applied design and analysis of experiments course. We will discuss how to analyze a variety of experiments: one-way and two-way layouts, incomplete block designs, factorial designs, random effects, split-plot and nested designs.

Homework will be assigned weekly or biweekly (about 7 assignments). There is one close-book midterm exam in class (calculator and one double-sided formula sheet are allowed) and one final group project.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Basic probability and statistics courses (e.g., Stat 320-2)

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: By the end of the class students are expected to (1) formulate statistical questions for a real life problem; (2) plan and design an appropriate experiment to test the hypothesis, (3) choose the appropriate statistical methods for data analysis and justify the choice; (4) perform data analysis using SAS programming; (5) describe and present the data analysis results.
